attributes.action: Require impact assessments and approval of MPs for all emergency legislation
attributes.additional_details:
The Health Protection (Coronavirus, Restrictions) (England) Regulations 2020 was enacted without an impact assessment and parliamentary approval happened post implementation. There is increasing evidence that lockdowns & other non-pharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) caused harm to large numbers of people.
 
Children's education was harmed, medical treatment delayed and people's health & fitness substantially reduced. Isolation caused mental health issues, especially for children, elderly & those living alone.
attributes.background: Replace emergency procedures in the Public Health Act 1984 (including the section 45R, the urgency procedure that allows a single minister to implement emergency legislation), with revised legislation that requires an impact assessment and approval by MPs before legislation comes into effect.
